byline.contributor: Patrick McGeehan and Kate Taylor contributed reporting.

abstract: Topless women hold march in Midtown Manhattan to exercise their right to go shirtless in public, drawing many spectators; marchers express support for desnudas, topless women wearing body paint and headdresses who have been posing with tourists for tips in Times Square, evoking suggestion from New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio that area's pedestrian plazas be removed.
lead_paragraph: The semi-clad marchers, who were vastly outnumbered by spectators, were not panhandlers, but were advocating the right of all women to go bare-chested if they chose.

headline.main: Seeking Equality, Not Tips, Topless Marchers Draw a Crowd in Manhattan
headline.print_headline: Seeking Equality, Not Tips, Topless Marchers Draw a Crowd in Manhattan

snippet: The semi-clad marchers, who were vastly outnumbered by spectators, were not panhandlers, but were advocating the right of all women to go bare-chested if they chose.
